verses.text: Doth not wisdom cry? And understanding put forth her voice?
She standeth in the top of high places by the way, \add In\add* the places of the paths.
She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, \add At\add* the coming in at the doors.
Unto you, O men, I call; And my voice \add is\add* to the sons of man.
O ye simple, understand wisdom: And, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
Hear, for I will speak of excellent things; And the opening of my lips \add shall be\add* right things.
For my mouth shall speak truth; And wickedness \add is\add* an abomination to my lips.
All the words of my mouth \add are\add* in righteousness; \add There is\add* nothing froward or perverse in them.
They \add are\add* all plain to him that understandeth, And right to them that find knowledge.
Receive my instruction, and not silver; And knowledge rather than choice gold.
For wisdom \add is\add* better than rubies; And all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
I wisdom dwell \add with\add* prudence, And find out knowledge of witty inventions.
The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* to hate evil: Pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, And the froward mouth, do I hate.
Counsel \add is\add* mine, and sound wisdom: I \add am\add* understanding; I have strength.
By me kings reign, And princes decree justice.
By me princes rule, And nobles, \add even\add* all the judges of the earth.
I love them that love me; And those that seek me early shall find me.
Riches and honour \add are\add* with me; \add Yea\add*, durable riches and righteousness.
My fruit \add is\add* better than gold, yea, than fine gold; And my revenue than choice silver.
I lead in the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of judgment:
That \add I\add* may cause those that love me to inherit substance; And I will fill their treasures.
The \sc Lord\sc* possessed me \add in\add* the beginning of his way, Before his works of old.
I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, Or ever the earth was.
When \add there were\add* no depths, I was brought forth; When \add there were\add* no fountains abounding with water.
Before the mountains were settled, Before the hills was I brought forth:
While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, Nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
When he prepared the heavens, I \add was\add* there: When he set a compass upon the face of the depth:
When he established the clouds above: When \add he\add* strengthened the fountains of the deep:
When he gave to the sea his decree, That the waters should not pass his commandment; When he appointed the foundations of the earth:
Then I was by him, \add as\add* one brought up \add with him\add*: And I was daily \add his\add* delight, Rejoicing always before him;
Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; And my delights \add were\add* with the sons of men.
Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: For blessed \add are they that\add* keep my ways.
Hear instruction, and be wise, And refuse \add it\add* not.
Blessed \add is\add* the man that heareth me, Watching daily at my gates, Waiting at the posts of my doors.
For whoso findeth me findeth life, And shall obtain favour of the \sc Lord\sc*.
But he that sinneth \add against\add* me wrongeth his own soul: All they that hate me love death.
